properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 15 at 3:46AM PST until February 16 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton OR
properties.description:
...MOUNTAIN SNOW OVER THE WEEKEND...

.A weather system will pass over the Pacific Northwest bringing
moderate to heavy mountain snow. Snow will start this morning and
increase late today and overnight. Gusty winds could lead to
areas of blowing and drifting snow. More light mountain snow
showers expected Sunday afternoon into President's Day.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8
inches. Some blowing and drifting snow will be possible tonight
and Sunday.

* WHERE...Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon.

* WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel over the Blue
mountains could become difficult.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SUNDAY
